appendix.title: Configuration Options Reference
appendix.para: Reference of options available in ELinks version 0.5pre0.CVS.

listitem.para: First write data to 'file.tmp', then rename to 'file' upon successfully finishing this. Note that this relates only to config files, not downloaded files. You may want to disable it, if you want some config file with some exotic permissions. Secure file saving is automagically disabled if file is symlink.
File format for bookmarks (affects both reading and saving):

simplelist.member: is the default ELinks (Links 0.9x compatible) format
is XBEL universal XML bookmarks format (NO NATIONAL CHARS SUPPORT!) (DISABLED)

listitem.para: Amount of comments automatically written to the config file:

simplelist.member: is no comments are written
is only the "blurb" (name+type) is written
is only the description is written
is full comments are written

listitem.para: Shift width of one indentation level in the configuration file. Zero means that no indentation is performed at all when saving the configuration.
Determines what happens when you tell ELinks to save options:

simplelist.member: is only values of current options are altered
is values of current options are altered and missing options
are added at the end of the file
is the configuration file is rewritten from scratch
is values of current options are altered and missing options
CHANGED during this ELinks session are added at the end of

Show _template_ options in autocreated trees in the options manager and save them to the configuration file.
Maximum number of concurrent connections to a given host.

listitem.para: When enabled, we'll require three dots in cookies domain for all non-international domains (instead of just two dots). Please see code (cookies.c:check_domain_security()) for explanation.
Save cookies after each change in cookies list? No effect when cookies_save is off.
Size of the virtual margin - when you click inside of that margin, document scrolls in that direction.
Move by columns in table, instead of rows.

sect3.title: Accesskeys (document.browse.accesskey)
sect3.para: Options for handling of the accesskey attribute of the active HTML elements.

listitem.para: Automatically follow a link or submit a form if appropriate accesskey is pressed - this is the standard behaviour, but it's considered dangerous.

simplelist.member: is first try all normal bindings; if it fails, check accesskey
is first try only frame bindings; if it fails, check accesskey
is first check accesskey (this can be dangerous)

sect3.para: Options for handling of the forms interaction.

listitem.para: Automagically submit a form when enter is pressed with a text field selected.
Ask for confirmation when submitting a form.

simplelist.member: means always display just [IMG]

sect3.title: Links (document.browse.links)
sect3.para: Options for handling of links to other documents.

listitem.para: Highlight links to directories in FTP and local directory listing.
Number keys select links rather than specify command prefixes. This is a tristate:

simplelist.member: never
if document.browse.links.numbering = 1
always

listitem.para: Display numbers next to the links.
When pressing 'down' on the last link, jump at the first one, and vice versa.
Ignore Cache-Control and Pragma server headers. When set, the document is cached even with 'Cache-Control: no-cache'.
Ignore charset info sent by server.
Allow dark colors on black background.
Default directory color. See document.browse.links.color_dirs option.

simplelist.member: is use always the default settings
is use document colors if available, except background
is use document colors, including background. This can
look really impressive mostly, but few sites look really
ugly there (unfortunately including slashdot (but try to
let him serve you that 'plain' version and the world will
suddenly become a much more happy place for life)). Note
that obviously if the background isn't black, it will
break transparency, if you have it enabled for your terminal
and on your terminal.

sect2.title: HTML rendering (document.html)
sect2.para: Options concerning the display of HTML pages.

listitem.para: Comma separated list of domains for which the proxy (HTTP/FTP) should be disabled. Optionally, a port can be specified for some domains as well. If it's blank, NO_PROXY environment variable is checked as well.
Allow reading from non-regular files? (DANGEROUS - reading /dev/urandom or /dev/zero can ruin your day!)
When set, if we can't open a file named 'filename', we'll try to open 'filename' + some encoding extensions (ie. 'filename.gz'); it depends on the supported encodings.
FTP anonymous password to be sent.
Use EPSV instead of EPRT (passive vs active mode, IPv6 only).
Use PASV instead of PORT (passive vs active mode, IPv4 only).
Host and port-number (host:port) of the FTP proxy, or blank. If it's blank, FTP_PROXY environment variable is checked as well.

Request localised versions of documents from web-servers (using the Accept-Language header) using the language you have configured for ELinks' user-interface. Note that some see this as a potential security risk because it tells web-masters about your preference in language.

Change the User Agent ID. That means identification string, which is sent to HTTP server when a document is requested. %v in the string means ELinks version %s in the string means system identification %t in the string means size of the terminal Use " " if you don't want any User-Agent header to be sent at all.
Broken 302 redirect (violates RFC but compatible with Netscape). This is a problem for a lot of web discussion boards and the like.If they will do strange things to you, try to play with this.
Use HTTP/1.0 protocol instead of HTTP/1.1.
Disable keepalive connection after POST request.
Host and port-number (host:port) of the HTTP proxy, or blank. If it's blank, HTTP_PROXY environment variable is checked as well.
Fake referer to be sent when policy is 2.

simplelist.member: is send no referer
is send current URL as referer
is send fixed fake referer
is send previous URL as referer (correct, but insecure)

listitem.para: Mailcap search path. Colon-separated list of files. Leave as "" to use MAILCAP environment variable or build-in defaults instead.
Prioritize entries by the order of the files in the mailcap path. This means that wildcard entries (like: image/*) will also be checked before deciding the handler.
Show status bar on the screen.
